amendatorysection.catchline: Merger or consolidation; filings required; when effective.
amendatorysection.para: (1) After a plan of merger or consolidation is approved as provided in section 21-2649, the surviving entity or the new entity shall deliver to the Secretary of State for filing articles of merger or consolidation duly executed by each constituent entity setting forth:
(a) The name of each constituent entity;
(b) The plan of merger or consolidation;
(c) The effective date of the merger or consolidation if later than the date of filing of the articles of merger or consolidation;
(d) The name of the surviving entity or the new entity; and
(e) A statement that the plan of merger or consolidation was duly authorized and approved by each constituent entity in accordance with section 21-2649.
(2) A merger or consolidation takes effect upon the later of the effective date of the filing of the articles of merger or consolidation or the date set forth in the plan of merger or consolidation.

(3) Duplicate originals of the articles of merger or consolidation shall be delivered to the Secretary of State who, after determining that such documents appear in all respects to conform to the requirements of sections 21-2647 to 21-2652, shall file one of the duplicate originals and endorse on each duplicate original the word filed with the month, day, and year of the filing thereof and return one duplicate original to the surviving entity or the new entity or its representative.
